content: a lively little toad s ggrraannnnyy ssttrriippee sswweeaatteerr universal sizing by holly lively overview pattern is written in us terms for this pattern you will be using the same crochet hook size and yarn weight that you used to make your lively little toad this pattern is universal it will work for any size toad you decide to make as long as those elements match a gauge swatch isn t necessary but by row 2 you will know if it will fit your toad you may find you need to go up a hook size depending on personal gauge stitches/terms used chain slip_stitch skip double_crochet 3dc between posts very simple exactly how it sounds photos of this are included important notes i highly recommend tying secure knots and sewing/weaving in the ends as you go after every color change if you re using more than 2 colors after row 2 you may begin your row in any gap you prefer when making the body and arm portions chain 3 always counts as first double_crochet body begin with your first color change colors after each row if desired chain 36 slip_stitch into first chain to close circle 36 row 1 chain 3 counts as first double_crochet double_crochet in each stitch around slip_stitch into top of first stitch to close round 36 row 2 slip_stitch between two posts to begin next row chain 3 2dc in the same space *skip 3 posts 3dc between posts* repeat * around slip_stitch to close round 36 or 12 clusters row 3-4 slip_stitch into any gap chain 3 2dc in same gap 3dc in next gap and each gap across slip_stitch into top of first stitch to close round 36 or 12 clusters tie off any loose ends and set aside for later arms begin each arm with your first color change colors after each row if desired chain 12 slip_stitch into very first stitch to close 12 row 1 chain 3 double_crochet in each stitch around slip_stitch to close round 12 row 2 slip_stitch between posts chain 3 2dc in same space *skip 3 posts 3dc between posts* around slip_stitch to close round 12 or 4 clusters row 3-4 slip_stitch in gap chain 3 2dc in same gap 3dc in next gap and each gap around slip_stitch to close round 12 or 4 clusters complete 2 arms tie each off securely but leave tails several inches long to tie the arms to the body portion joining tie arms symmetrically onto the body portion they should have 6 clusters 18 double_crochet posts between them on each side row 5 slip_stitch into gap before the underarm knot on body portion chain 3 2dc in same gap 3dc into next gap skipping the underarm gaps where we tied the knot indicated by the arrows 3dc each gap around
